html:
Updates

** Shares of EV startup RIVN.O down 4.8% at $85.66, paring losses that sent them briefly below the IPO price of $78

** RIVN fell as much as 16.5% to hit a record low of $75.13 in early trading, after rising ~1% premarket (Full Story)

** RIVN had closed over 11% lower on Wednesday after one of its biggest investors, Amazon.com Inc AMZN.O, said it would collaborate with Stellantis NV STLA.MI to develop cars, trucks with AMZN's software in the dashboards, and deploy its electric vans (Full Story)

** AMZN had previously agreed to buy up to 100,000 Rivian electric delivery vans and has exclusive rights to RIVN's vans for four years, according to a regulatory filing from October

** Other key EV stocks Tesla Inc TSLA.O down ~4%, Fisker FSR.N loses 3.3%, Lucid LCID.O down 5%, while Nikola NKLA.O gains 0.3%

** So far this week, market participants have rotated out of technology-heavy growth shares, with the Nasdaq .IXIC plunging more than 3% on Wednesday, its biggest one-day percentage drop since February (Full Story)



(Reporting by Akash Sriram and Eva Mathews in Bengaluru)

(( Akash.Sriram@thomsonreuters.com ;))
